moduleIdentity.description:
Enterprise MIB for Transparent LAN Service
on Nortel Networks Equipment.

objectType.description:
Provisioning information for a collection of
TLS capable interfaces attached to a particular
system.

Provisioning information for a particular TLS
capable interface.

An index value that uniquely identifies an TLS
capable interface. The interface identified by
a particular value of this index is the same
interface as identified by the same value of
ifIndex.

Identifies the service type being provided
on this interface.

Physical address of the remote iPT node to
which all packets will be forwarded. This
attribute applies only to TLS interfaces of
type p2p (point to point).

Port number on the remote iPT node to which
all packets will be forwarded. This attribute
applies only to TLS interfaces of type p2p
(point to point).

The number of ingress MAC frames discarded
because they could not be classified into a TD.
This attribute applies only to TLS interfaces
of type Mapped or Transparent modes.

In order to allow non-TLS equipment
(accelar routers,etc) to separate Customer frames
from Management/Control Frames, NNI ports will tag
every customer frame exiting the NNI (at egress) with
this 802.1q tag. This attribute only applies to
interfaces with a TLS interface type of tls-nni,
or tls-ip-nni.

In order to allow non-TLS equipment
(accelar routers,etc) to separate Management frames
from Customer Frames, NNI ports will tag
every Management frame exiting the NNI (at egress) with
this 802.1q tag. This attribute only applies to
interfaces with a TLS interface type of tls-nni,
or tls-ip-nni.
The IP address of this interface
The default gateway address of this interface
The mode of this interface
Initiate an action pertaining to a port. ie, ARP.
Result from the last If action

The subnet mask for the UNI port. For release
9.2, this is simply a mirror of the CPU subnet
mask and thus is read-only. Future releases
might include multi-subnetting and hence might
change this to read-write.

Indicate whether the default customer Qtag on this
port is filtered (dropped) on egress and Ingress.
This value will be set to true for filtered and
false if not filtered.

Used to enable/disable the tlsTDStateChanged
Notification for all TDs on the port.

The nubmer of packets received where the cpu port
mode is not matched with the source port's capability
(as shown in the FDB)

The nubmer of packets sent where the cpu port
mode is not matched with the destination port's
capability (as shown in the FDB)

Provisioning information for a collection of
Transparent Domains relevant at this system.

Provisioning information for a particular
Transparent Domain on this system.

A network wide identifier for a particular
Transparent Domain.

A text string providing further information about
the registrant/owner of a particular Transparent
Domain.

Index of the TLS/IP UNI table entry which is to
be used by this TD when communicating in the TLS/IP
network. A value of zero indicates that only TLS/L2
en/decapsulation will be done for this TD.

An IP multicast address which is to be used by this
TD for flooding on th TLS/IP network. This attribute
is only relevant for TDs which are associated with a
TLS/IP UNI. A value of 0.0.0.0 should be reported
for TDs which are not associated with a
TLS/IP UNI.

Boolean value indicating whether the TLS Flush
protocol is enabled for this TD. This protocol
can only be enabled on TDs which are running full
TLS/IP, and must be disabled otherwise.

The maximum delay in seconds before IP unicasting
to a newly learned MAC destination. This is
only valid if the TLS Flush protocol is enabled.

Maps 802.1p priorities (0-7) to iPT class-of-service
(COS) values (0-7) for packets across a UNI. The
first bytes represent the COS of the iPT
frame encapsulating a packet with an 802.1p priority
of 0. Subsequent bytes represent the mappings
of the remaining 802.1p priorities.

The default priority map is a mapping of 802.1p
priorities to their iPT COS equivalent
Used to create/delete an entry.

Statistics about the operation of a collection
of Transparent Domains.

Statistics about the operation of a particular
Transparent Domain.

The value of the instance of the tlsTDId object for
the Transparent Domain for which these stats are
collected.

Number of TLS frames received from the TLS network
by this TD.

Number of TLS frames sent into the TLS network by
this TD.
Number of unicast MAC frames ingressed on this TD.
Number of unicast MAC frames egressed on this TD.

Number of unicast MAC frames which arrived at ingress
for which the MAC destination address (DA) was not
found in the FDB for this TD.
Number of multicast MAC frames ingressed on this TD.
Number of multicast MAC frames egressed on this TD.
Number of broadcast MAC frames ingressed on this TD.
Number of broadcast MAC frames egressed on this TD.
Number of octets ingressed on this TD.
Number of octets egressed on this TD.

Provisioned mappings (or classification functions)
between {ifIndex, Tag Value} : tlsTDId.

Mapping from a particular {ifIndex, Tag Value} pair
to a Transparent Domain.

The value of the instance of the ifIndex object,
defined in MIB-II, over which this mapping is
valid.

Tag Value for which this mapping is valid.

0-4095 = 802.1Q Tagged Frames
4096 = Untagged Frame
4097 = Transparent

Transparent Domain in which to classify frames
matching the key for this table entry.
Used to create/delete an entry.

Maps 802.1p priorities (0-7) to Optical Ethernet
class-of-service (COS) values (0-7) for packets
across a UNI. The first bytes represent the COS for
802.1p priority of 0. Subsequent bytes represent the
mappings of the remaining 802.1p priorities.

Indicate whether service has been activated on
this TD.
The TD connectivity type.

Statistics about the operation of a collection
of Transport Domain Interfaces.

Statistics about the operation of a particular
Transparent Domain Interface.

The value of the instance of the ifIndex object,
defined in MIB-II, for which these statistics are
collected.

The Tag Value for which these statistics are
collected.
Number of unicast MAC frames ingressed on this TDIf.
Number of unicast MAC frames egressed on this TDIf.

Number of unicast MAC frames which arrived at ingress
for which the MAC destination address (DA) was not
found in the FDB for this TDIf.

Number of multicast MAC frames ingressed on this
TDIf.

Number of multicast MAC frames egressed on this
TDIf.

Number of broadcast MAC frames ingressed on this
TDIf.
Number of broadcast MAC frames egressed on this TDIf.
Number of octets ingressed on this TDIf.
Number of octets egressed on this TDIf.

TLS filtering database. There exists one FDB per port
per TD.

Information on a learned or static MAC entry
on a per interface, per TD basis

The Transparent Domain Identifier for which this
entry contains filtering database information.

The value of the instance of the ifIndex object
defined in MIB-II to which this FDB entry pertains.

The Ethernet MAC address pertaining to this
FDB entry.

Physical address of the destination iPT node to
which packets destined to the tlsFdbMac will be
forwarded on this ring. This may be the local RPR
node.

Interface index of the port on the destination
RPR node to which packets are forwarded.

The type of the entry in regards to static or
dynamic (learned).

Unicast IP Address of the destination TLS UNI
for this entry. A value of 0.0.0.0 should be
reported for TDs which are not associated with
an OEL2 UNI.
Used to create/delete an entry.
This entry is either remote or local to the node.

This entry is either remote or local to the ring
subnet. This value is unsupported for OEL2.

This entry is either in tls-L2 format, OEL2
format, or is unknown.

The maximum remote port capability - ie, it can
understand tls-l2, oel2, both tls-l2 and oel2,
or is unknown.

The IP address of the entry's default gateway.
This value is unsupported for OEL2.
The IMac address of the gateway nni port.
The EMac address of the entry's gateway.

The virtual port on the gateway NNI port. This
value is unsupported for OEL2
This entry is either remote or local to the port.

The NNITDIF table contains the NNI port TDI to
Qtag mappings for this entity
An NNI port TDI to Qtag mapping
The port on which this entry resides

Transparent Domain in which to classify frames
matching the key for this table entry.

Tag Value for which this mapping is valid.
1-4094 = 802.1Q Tagged Frames
4095 = unused and disallowed
4096 = Untagged Frame

Filter value for dropping frames for this td to
Qtag mapping. This value will be set to true for
filtered frames and false for frames not being
filtered
Used to create/delete an entry.

The Arp table contains the current ARP cache
information for this entity
An iPT Arp cache entry
The port on which this entity resides
The IP address of the default gateway in this entry

The MAC address corresponding to the router
in this entry

The MAC address of the NNI port connected to
the router
The Virtual Port number of the router
Is this entry a static entry?
The time to live of this ARP cache entry
Used to create/delete an entry in this table

The number of unresolved entries resulting
from ARPS
The number of ARP responses received with errors
Statistics pertaining to IGMP multicast
Statistics pertaining to IGMP for a specific TD

The multicast address belonging to the group
for which these stats are collected.

The number of membership reports received by
this multicast group

The number of membership reports sent by this
multicast group

The number of queries received by this multicast
group.

The number of general queries received by
the system

The number of IGMP packets received with an
invalid type
The IGMP packets received with errors
